61.66.text:
I was initially baptized
in the Holy Spirit in a way

65.12.text: that perhaps a lot of people haven't been.

68.18.text:
And my baptism in the Holy Spirit
actually took place on 9/11.

80.66.text:
>> I remember the first time,
I think the first time I ever

84.04.text:
experienced the presence of God was
the family retreat that I was on.

88.30.text:
I was maybe five or six years old,
and we were actually at a campfire.

92.90.text:
And there's something about fires that
just kind of capture your imagination.

96.75.text:
You can just sit and look at it, and
as a child that's especially the case.

100.87.text:
I remember looking at the campfire,
and it was popping and

104.18.text: the embers were flying up into the sky.

106.42.text: And it was late at night.

107.44.text: It was dark, it was pitch dark.

108.99.text:
And the stars were out, and I would
watch the embers go up into the sky.

113.50.text: And they would get lost in the stars.

116.46.text:
And for a little five-year-old kid,
this was just, I don't know, I was just

122.17.text:
awed by the size, the immensity of the
stars and the universe and all of that.

127.74.text:
And I remember that night,
in the midst of that,

132.82.text:
the world seems so big,
and I seem so small.

139.48.text:
But the coolest thing is that at that
moment, I knew that God was real.

144.98.text:
I knew beyond any shadow of a doubt,
that in the moment of the fire and

149.58.text:
the stars in the sky and
the universe, God's spirit,

153.29.text:
yeah God's spirit came upon
this little five year old kid.

157.35.text:
And I knew that God was real,
I knew that Jesus was real.

160.33.text:
I knew the stories that I'd heard as
a kid were real all around this campfire.

165.66.text: So campfires remind of things like that.

168.20.text:
But campfires also remind
me of the scriptures.

171.54.text:
It's beautiful when you
take a look at the third,

173.81.text: I think it's the third chapter of Matthew.

176.90.text:
I am baptizing you with water for
repentance, but

179.75.text:
the one who comes after
me is mightier than I.

182.58.text: I am not worthy to carry his sandals.

185.14.text:
He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and
in fire.

189.47.text:
I remember the first time
I was asked whether or

192.44.text:
not I had been baptized
in the Holy Spirit.

195.68.text:
I decided to take a year off of college to
kind of figure out my vocation, whether or

199.78.text: not God wanted me to be a priest.

201.01.text:
So I spent a year with
the National Evangelization teams.

203.94.text:
They were stationed in St.
Paul, Minnesota.

207.08.text:
And I remember my mom had
taken me to the center.

210.47.text:
So my mom would drop me off at the net
center and right before I get out of

213.90.text:
the car she says to me, she says,
Dave, this group might be charismatic.

218.66.text:
And I said to her, well,
I mean, charismatic?

222.90.text: I was serious about my faith.

225.04.text:
And she said, well, yeah,
you would be considered,

227.70.text:
but these people are probably
gonna be different.

233.00.text:
Well, I remember I get, and I get settled
at the center, and somebody says to me,

236.97.text: we're gonna have a prayer meeting tonight.

238.15.text: Would you be interested in coming?

242.86.text:
There was about a 100 people about
my age and they were praying.

247.12.text:
They were singing a song, and
there was just really something cool and

249.60.text:
life giving about that many young people
my age just praying and singing the song.

255.49.text:
the only problem was, was when
the song ended, they kept on singing.

259.41.text:
And they were saying things
that I didn't know and

261.34.text: saying things that I couldn't understand.

262.70.text:
This one guy next to me was screaming,
just shouting the name of Jesus, and

266.50.text: shouting all kinds of praise of God.

268.37.text: And, I'd never seen anything like this.

270.75.text:
I mean, where I grew up,
when the song was over, you were quiet.

273.89.text:
And, these people just
kept on hollering and

275.80.text:
screaming and
yelling about how much they loved God.

278.94.text:
And, this was just really,
really strange to me.

280.94.text: I just didn't know what to do.

281.91.text:
And, some of them were praying, and I
couldn't understand what they were saying.

285.17.text:
And, it was just really,
really strange, really odd.

287.71.text:
And well the next day I must have
looked like I didn't quite fit in,

292.62.text:
So this guy comes up to me and says to me,

297.53.text: And I didn't exactly know what that meant.

298.82.text:
I had never been asked
that question before.

300.78.text:
And I said, well,
yeah I mean I was baptized as a baby.

303.86.text:
He goes, no, no, no,
when were you baptized in the Holy Spirit?

307.86.text: And I didn't know what he meant.

308.81.text: So I guess I said, I don't know.

310.70.text: And he goes, well, I wanna pray with you.

312.12.text:
He goes, I wanna place my hands on you,
and I wanna pray with you.

315.00.text: And it's like, you're not touching me.

316.40.text:
This guy was just was
too serious about this.

320.08.text:
Well, there was something interesting
cuz I'd never really heard the term,

322.66.text: the baptism in the Holy Spirit.

323.73.text:
And I had this understanding that
there was something different the way

327.35.text:
It was, they were more alive than I
think I was, or what I experienced.

331.48.text:
And so I began to ask some of
the people who were there,

334.72.text:
I began to ask them about this
baptism in the Holy Spirit.

338.18.text:
And what I came to understand that the
baptism in the Holy Spirit is actually one

341.66.text:
of the few things that's
mentioned in all the gospels.

344.15.text:
Matthew, Mark, Luke and
John, they all mention and

346.20.text: speak of the baptism in the Holy Spirit.

Scripture says that Jesus
came to baptize us.

350.96.text: As I read, John the Baptist was saying,

352.97.text:
Jesus came to baptize us in
the Holy Spirit and in fire.

355.70.text:
The Acts of the Apostles,
first chapter, go to Jerusalem and

360.20.text: wait for the baptism of Holy Spirit.

362.89.text: But it was foreign to me.

365.55.text: And the way they were praying,

366.95.text:
they began to talk about the gifts of the
Holy Spirit, the gifts of Prophecy, and

370.60.text:
the gifts of healing, the gift of tongues,

374.06.text:
All of that,
none of that was familiar to me.

375.88.text:
And yet they showed me in the scripture

379.18.text:
the scripture which in one sense confused
me because I was familiar with the Bible.

383.04.text:
Why hadn't I read and
thought and heard about this?

385.45.text: But I just didn't know to make of it.

389.14.text:
And every time I saw this guy he was like,

391.84.text: I want to pray with you.

392.82.text: I said all right, you're not touching me.

396.58.text:
Well, I knew, instinctively I knew
that there was something about

400.90.text:
the baptism in the Holy Spirit
that made these people different.

405.28.text:
People my age,
the way they spoke of Jesus,

407.46.text:
the way they spoke of faith,
it was different than what I did.

414.49.text: I was in this small chapel.

417.93.text:
Yeah, the carpet looked
like it came from the 70s.

420.71.text:
It was this yellow shag run, and there

424.95.text:
There weren't any chairs in the chapel,

429.87.text:
there was the picture of Jesus
that was famous back then.

I call it Jesus' senior picture,

435.39.text:
that kind of Jesus with the flowing hair,
huh?

439.38.text: There was just one light in the chapel.

441.11.text: It was just a votive light.

And in the chapel I just found myself,

452.33.text:
the Lord, and
pouring my heart out to him and praying.

And I remember saying, Lord,

457.72.text:
I don't understand what's going on and

461.55.text:
And I don't understand what the baptism

I don't understand this whole
charismatic what that's all about.

I was just really honestly just praying,
and

471.66.text:
there was an authentic prayer that

And I remember I said to the Lord, I said
Lord I don't understand the baptism and

480.52.text:
the Holy Spirit, but
if you want this for me, then I want it.

My life has never been

496.09.text:
That God came upon me and

God wasn't just some distant

I felt like I was being

So I felt His love, and His love,

518.08.text:
It wasn't just he loved the world but that

this presence that changed me,

From that moment I can say that

At that moment I began to
just pray quietly, and

And then I began to pray in the spirit,

And I didn't exactly understand what

In Romans VIII it says that in our

understand and

For God so

That we are children of God,

John VI and

The scripts just came alive in

I was an active Catholic and

And I said to him,

the Holy Spirit, I was like, something in

This fire that I know I started

Father just starts going down the line

I'm like dude, I'm about to get

on the floor, resting in the Spirit,

This was the moment, and I went and

This was my time to receive this,

And he just randomly says, is there anyone

I just shot my hand up, and

It wasn't anything crazy,
but I got up and he's like,

And I went into the most insane tongues,
and

I had never really seen

And I felt in my spirit the most

Joy, peace, happiness that I've

After that moment that night everything

because of the baptism in the Holy Spirit

>> So it was on the morning

My office overlooked the National Airport
all the way over to Georgetown.

Just spectacular views

trying to find out what
had happened in New York.

I had a lot of friends that

817.92.text:
And I had heard about

821.40.text:
And the next thing I knew,
a ball of fire and

824.33.text:
smoke was just billowing
above the Pentagon.

829.31.text:
And as I watched this,
a ball of fire and smoke,

834.30.text:
I just realized that
my life was like that.

838.80.text: It was just simply in ashes, and

842.45.text:
as I watched the destruction
that was performing.

849.06.text:
And then I felt there the presence

854.14.text:
And I could not wait to

858.33.text:
IT was like the prodigal
son coming his senses and

863.47.text:
just realizing that it was back with
the Father where I needed to be.

869.64.text: Back into a relationship with Him.

871.23.text: And I realized that I had abandoned Him.

873.63.text: Within a moment I was in tears.

881.67.text:
For the first time I was truly
praying since many years prior.

887.09.text:
And I was just overwhelmed by the sense

>> So when I experienced
the baptism in the Holy Spirit and

I reflect again what it says in
the third chapter of Matthew,

that I will baptise you in

906.89.text:
Fire seems to be three
things in Jesus's time.

916.07.text:
That when I experienced the baptism in
the Holy Spirit, there was an illumination

919.83.text:
that I saw things more clearly,
I saw things the way I didn't see before.

I mean, I had this experience

926.62.text:
I saw Jesus for who he was, not for

And not this image that I had created

The other thing that it
does is it purifies.

I really experienced a purification,

selfishness, and vice, and
a growth in the fruits of the Spirit.

So, turning away from vices and sin and

So the Holy Spirit in fire is
illumination, it's purification, and

974.97.text:
Again if you think of
a shepherd with his sheep,

977.60.text: that fire would protect against the wolf.

980.27.text: The wolf wouldn't come to the fire.

981.92.text:
So I experienced a greater protection of

987.15.text:
me, and tries to get to me but the grace

991.65.text:
So, it's this baptism
of the Holy Spirit and

993.80.text:
the baptism fire that each
of us should experience.

996.86.text: It's not just for me, it's for everybody.

I'd like to reflect on what

I think that's important, the baptism

1009.28.text: it's not just for a select few.

1012.79.text:
Let us rediscover,
dear brother and sisters,

the beauty of being baptized

1017.71.text:
Let us be aware of our baptism and

1028.05.text:
again today, a Pentecost that will

Everybody's invited to this but

a large population of people have never

I remember one time I

let us rediscover this

we really called upon the Holy Spirit

And we were really encouraged to

1173.27.text:
>> One of the things that I reflect
on is a line from St. Thomas Aquinas.

1178.37.text:
St. Thomas Aquinas was
raising the question.

1180.70.text:
He was saying, how is it possible
that somebody could be baptized,

1185.26.text:
confirmed, receive Eucharist and
not living a dynamic life of faith?

1191.53.text:
Well, he would say there'd
be a number of reasons.

1194.87.text: They could lack knowledge of the faith.

1198.17.text: They could be trapped in fear.

1199.15.text:
So there could be a number of reasons why
a person could receive the sacraments but

1203.40.text: not living a dynamic life of faith.

1206.23.text:
So St. Thomas Aquinas would go on to say,
he would say that what the individual

1210.81.text:
has experienced is they've experienced
the sacraments validly but

1213.53.text:
the grace of that sacrament is dormant,
it's asleep.

1217.18.text:
And St. Thomas Aquinas would say that
there needs to be a second sending, or

1220.53.text:
a resending, that awakens, or
releases is the language he uses, this

1226.12.text:
grace that was given to us, a baptism or
confirmation or every time we go to mass.

1231.06.text:
This resending, I think,
is the baptism on the Holy Spirit.

1234.58.text:
That we experience the grace
of the Holy Spirit,

1236.97.text:
the grace that was given to us at
baptism and confirmation awakens.

1240.82.text:
And our life is changed once again with
this resending of the Holy Spirit.

the Lord Jesus Christ, and the Father and

1253.04.text:
You know he wants us to be filled so
